name: Minimum Password Length
description: Ensure minimum password length is at least 14 characters.
rationale: Short passwords are easily brute-forced. Microsoft recommends 14+ characters for legacy systems, or MFA for modern ones.

name: Account Lockout Threshold
description: Account should lock after invalid login attempts.
rationale: Prevents brute-force attacks. A value between 5 and 10 is typically recommended.

name: Maximum Password Age
rationale: Rotates credentials to minimize impact of compromised hashes. 60-90 days is standard.

name: Wait for network at startup
description: Ensure synchronous processing for critical policies.
setting_name: Always wait for the network at computer startup and logon
rationale: Prevents issues where policies fail to apply because the network wasn't ready. Affects startup time but ensures reliability.

name: Admin Account Status
description: Built-in Administrator account should be disabled.
rationale: The built-in Administrator account is a known target. Disabling it forces attackers to guess usernames.
